content.question: At time <math alttext="t equals 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math>, a disk starts from rest and begins spinning about its center with a constant angular acceleration of magnitude <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>α</mi></mstyle></math>. At time <math alttext="t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math>, the disk has angular speed <math alttext="omega sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>ω</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mstyle></math>. Which of the following expressions correctly compares the final angular displacement <math alttext="theta sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></mstyle></math> of the disk at time <math alttext="t sub f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub></math> to the angular displacement <math alttext="theta sub one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>1/2</mtext></msub></mstyle></math> at time <math alttext="the fraction t sub f over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><msub><mi>t</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="theta sub f equals the fraction theta sub one half over 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mfrac><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>1/2</mtext></msub><mn>4</mn></mfrac></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="theta sub f equals theta sub one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>1/2</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="theta sub f equals 2 theta sub one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>θ</mi><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="theta sub f equals 4 theta sub one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>1/2</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="theta sub f equals 4 theta sub one half" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>θ</mi><mi>f</mi></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>θ</mi><mtext>1/2</mtext></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
